name: The Royal an Lochan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Royal An Lochan at the weekend and had a lovely stay.
reviews.title: A lovely pampered stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The drive over from Loch Lomond was stunning, we were very lucky with the weather and the view from our window was amazing! We had dinner at the hotel and felt very well looked after and pampered, but did end up spending a lot of money! We had wonderful langouistines as a starter then i had halibut and my boyfriend steak it was all beautifully prepared. After dinner we drank our wine on the big comfy sofas infront of the fire. All very peaceful and relaxing. The public rooms of the hotel are decorated really nicely and feel warm and cosy.
reviews.title: Not at it was

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only complaint was that the rooms were a bit tired looking, the owners have done their best to make them look more than they are but i was disappointed in them for the amount of money we paid. Saying that the views and the service we received were amazing and made up for it!!
reviews.title: Good job there's the scenery.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the pub along in Kames for a drink earlier in the evening and that deft looked to have a bit more atmosphere, if we had stayed longer we would have liked to try out the food there. It was only a 20 min walk away and deft worth checking out. On the way back try the road along Loch Fyne, it was just stunning, although single track the whole way!
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we booked we did not and was told that it was under new management,The hotel is now looking a bit under the weather (tired)
reviews.title: Comfy hotel with fabulous food and great customer service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at this Hotel 5 or more times in the past and keep coming back.
reviews.title: Superb Standards at this Hotel

reviews.text: The Royal has recently got new owners and we just have to say that nothing has changed regarding the Service, Food, Comfort and above all , the Friendliness of Christine and her Husband Keith and Hazel and all the Staff there.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel - A Delightful Place to Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing is too much trouble to them.
reviews.title: Relaxing atmosphere, little tired decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One word of warning though, your waistband will be a lot tighter on leaving this bit of Heaven in the Kyles.
reviews.title: oh dear things have changed and not for the better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights at The Royal this week with a friend. Splendid! Beautiful location, had a lovely superior twin room with spacious bathroom and great views over the loch. The food was excellent both nights and the breakfasts were just as good. Dinner was in a conservatory with great views out to sea. They only had one real ale on offer (due to expand) but again, excellent. The atmosphere of the place was relaxing and the staff (Hazel in particular) was very hospitable and welcoming and couldn't be more helpful. D,B&B was good value for the quality we received. Can't recommend this place enough. We will definitely stay here again in the future. Thanks guys for a great stay!
reviews.title: Enthusiastic new owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very comfortable spacious room with beautiful views over the Kyles of Bute. Under new ownership and feel that they will do well as they have good standard of customer care. Evening meal in the 'Shinty' bar was excellent. They just need to get the locals back to get more atmosphere. Good luck.
reviews.title: Beautiful Setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just spent last Thursday and Friday staying at this fabulous hotel. Immediately we were upgraded to a massive room with stunning views and an amazing bathroom with roll top bath and huge separate shower.
reviews.title: Absolutely Super!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is now under new management who we just thought were great. They were so helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: An excellent stay at an excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had two excellent breakfasts (the fish can be highly recommended), afternoon tea with yummy home-made goodies and super 3 course dinners all locally sourced fresh produce.
reviews.title: Excellent food, wonderful views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After dinner there was a vast array of board games to play in-front of the fire curled up on the comfy sofas enjoying your coffee / whisky or your choice of drink.
reviews.title: Stunning setting, cosy shabby chic hotel, lovely food and friendly welcoming staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a friendly welcome and efficient, attentive staff. the free seafood lunch on arrival set the tone for a great stay. quite a buzz about the place too, on a busy saturday evening in early april.
reviews.title: great location, great food. fantastic atmosphere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights in March. Dinner fantastic, breakfast great, room lovely, nice fires and sofas in lounges. got a great deal
reviews.title: Excellent stay
the best hotel experience we've had
reviews.text: We stayed for our 14th anniversary. Having read reviews we were wary of the price of the food and some of the amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am delighted to say that we had our best ever hotel experience.
reviews.title: Fabulous food and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was excellent throughout our stay, friendly and efficient, and the reception was exceptional. Complimentary afternoon tea with homebaking was just what we needed after a boneshaking bus ride from the Portavadie ferry in the tipping rain.
reviews.title: shabby chic

description: As you arrive the magical beach side setting will take your breath away. If you enjoy supremely fresh seafood and game, comfortable rooms with stunning views, great individual hospitality and an area with fabulous seascapes with a island feel your stay at An Lochan will leave nothing to be desired. We are however only 90 mins from Glasgow and on a scenic peninsula.
